data.name: InputSource
desc: specifies the Datasource plus some additional information for the parser.
There are two places where the application will deliver this input source to the parser:

items.name: aInputStream
lines: contains the byte input stream of the document.

items.name: sEncoding
lines: contains the encoding of the data stream.
This is used by the parser to do Unicode conversions.

Note that in general you do not need to specify an encoding. Either it is UTF-8 or UTF-16 which is recognized by the parser or it is specified in the first line of the XML-File ( e.g. ?xml encoding=\"EUC-JP\"? ).

items.name: sPublicId
lines: contains the public Id of the document, for example, needed in exception-message strings.

items.name: sSystemId
lines: contains the system ID of the document.
